# Overview 

\begin{itemize}
\small
  \item \textbf{Main task}: Choose one of the questions and write an original essay of 3,000 words (max)
  \vspace{0.15cm}
  \item The main task is to demonstrate an adequate understanding of the subject matter and relevant literatures, which means you should use readings or additional references on Moodle and in lecture slides
  \vspace{0.15cm}
  \item Deadline(s)
  \begin{itemize}
    \item Optional formative assessment: A reference list (no more than 20 refs), email it to me before \textbf{31 March 2025}
    \item Essay due on \textbf{23 April 2025} (midday/12pm)
  \end{itemize}
  \vspace{0.15cm}
  \item Support outside the classroom: 1:1 meetings with Chao-yo and Birkbeck's Study Skills workshops
  \vspace{0.15cm}
  \item \textbf{PG students}: You are free to choose a topic and conduct outside research, ideally in relation to the RQ for your dissertation project; in your formative assessment, include a one-paragraph topic statement (about 100 words)
\end{itemize}
